abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Agricultural Research
            and Extension Project in Morocco are as follows: overall
            outcome of the project was satisfactory, and the performance
            of the Bank and Borrower were also rated satisfactory. Some
            of the lessons learned from the project are: (a) the
            programming and budgeting by objectives is a complex
            approach that required nearly three years to be properly
            adopted by National Institute for Agricultural Research
            (INRA); (b) the latter successfully adapted the approach
            while benefiting from the continuous support from
            International Service for National Agricultural Research
            (ISNAR); (c) when research embarks on complex restructuring
            it is unrealistic to expect fast disbursement from the
            project onset; (d) research being a long term venture cannot
            operate on the basis of significant financial fluctuation
            over time thus careful planning is necessary when
            considering modifying sources of financing; and (e)
            modifying an approach to extension especially at the
            national level requires a clear vision and the defining of a
            strategy for extension at an early stage together with
            intense participation from farmers.
